basics.name: David Laing
basics.label: Software Engineer - Cloud Inference
basics.summary: Backend software engineer with 15+ years experience architecting and scaling distributed systems across GCP, AWS, and Kubernetes. Currently pioneering AI agent orchestration for cloud inference workflows, with deep expertise in building customer-focused APIs and optimizing cloud resource utilization. Strong track record of scaling platforms from startup to enterprise, including systems handling $3.5M/minute traffic and 100PB data infrastructure. Passionate about bringing responsible AI development practices to large-scale cloud inference systems.

work.position: Staff Software Engineer - AI Context Engineering Lead
work.summary: Leading AI agent orchestration initiatives with focus on scalable cloud inference. Building distributed systems on GCP and AWS for AI-assisted development workflows with emphasis on performance optimization and customer experience.
highlights: Pioneered AI agent orchestration for Kubernetes/Terraform automation - architecting scalable cloud inference systems where AI agents collaborate efficiently
Built and scaled cloud infrastructure on GCP and AWS optimizing for accelerator chip utilization and cost efficiency
Designed observable, scalable systems for AI agent deployment with comprehensive performance monitoring
Applied behavior-driven development to AI inference workflows ensuring reliable customer-facing systems
work.name: Mechanical Orchard

work.summary: Built full-stack applications from concept to production using modern web stack. Focused on creating customer-centric tools with scalable backend architecture and responsive user experiences.
highlights: Built Decision Copilot using NextJS, React, and TypeScript - full-stack application serving thousands of users
Designed and implemented scalable backend API architecture with Firebase and cloud functions
Optimized application performance and user experience through data-driven development practices
Established sustainable development practices balancing innovation with reliability
work.name: Make Time Together Ltd

work.summary: Scaled cloud infrastructure serving 3 million merchants during peak traffic events. Built and maintained distributed systems handling $3.5M/minute traffic with focus on performance optimization and customer experience.
highlights: Scaled platform infrastructure to handle $3.5M/minute peak traffic (BFCM) through strategic cloud resource optimization
Architected and maintained distributed systems for 100PB data warehouse with focus on availability and performance
Implemented performance optimization strategies reducing latency and improving customer experience across commerce platform
Built comprehensive monitoring and alerting systems for large-scale distributed infrastructure
work.name: Shopify Ltd

work.summary: Built and maintained scalable data pipelines for cross-portfolio analytics. Focused on creating customer-focused analytics systems and establishing performance optimization practices.
highlights: Architected and maintained dagster.io data pipelines serving analytics across VMware's product portfolio
Built scalable data processing systems with focus on performance optimization and resource utilization
Implemented customer-focused analytics APIs providing business intelligence across product teams
Established best practices for distributed system observability and performance monitoring
work.name: VMWare Ltd

work.summary: Led engineering initiatives across 80+ R&D teams globally. Built and scaled Cloud Foundry and Kubernetes platforms with focus on developer experience and system reliability.
highlights: Orchestrated engineering initiatives across 80+ R&D teams in 6 global offices, focusing on scalable platform development
Built and scaled Cloud Foundry and Kubernetes platforms serving thousands of developers
Established performance optimization practices for pivotaltracker.com serving 1M+ active users
Led technical mentorship and leadership development across distributed engineering teams
Collaborated on large-scale API platform design serving enterprise customers globally
work.name: Pivotal

work.summary: Co-founded company building distributed logging infrastructure. Scaled from concept to acquisition in 7 months, focusing on performance-critical systems for Cloud Foundry ecosystem.
highlights: Built scalable ELK distribution handling 2TB daily log processing with optimized performance characteristics
Designed high-performance distributed systems architecture for real-time log aggregation
Scaled product from concept to acquisition in 7 months through customer-focused development
work.name: StayUp.io Ltd

education.summary: Majored in Information Systems and Statistics with focus on scalable system design and data-driven development.

publications.name: From Values to Velocity: Building Momentum Through Aligned Systems
publications.summary: Exploration of how customer-focused development practices create sustainable team momentum in distributed system development

publications.name: Staying up-to-date with Kubernetes
publications.summary: Practical guide for scaling Kubernetes deployments and maintaining performance in cloud-native environments

projects.name: AI Cloud Inference Platform
projects.description: Leading development of scalable AI agent orchestration systems optimized for cloud inference workloads, with focus on performance, cost efficiency, and customer experience.
highlights: Architected distributed AI inference systems with optimized resource utilization across GCP and AWS
Built customer-focused APIs for AI agent deployment and management with comprehensive performance monitoring
Implemented cost optimization strategies reducing cloud inference costs while maintaining performance SLAs
Established best practices for responsible AI deployment in cloud environments

projects.name: Decision Copilot Platform

highlights: Built complete backend API architecture serving thousands of users with Firebase integration
Implemented real-time collaboration features with optimized performance characteristics

Established monitoring and observability practices for production web applications
